docs.lead_paragraph: SINCE he founded the Hain Food Group in Uniondale in 1993, Irwin D. Simon has guided the concern from that of a small natural and specialty food consolidator to a marketer of more than 1,000 niche food products under 11 brand names. Mr. Simon, the company's president and chief executive officer, received the Entrepreneur of the Year award last year from Ernst & Young after increasing the company's sales from $2 million in 1993 to $65 million last year. The son of a local retail-store owner, Mr. Simon was born in Glace Bay, Canada. His first job in 1982 was as assistant product manager of William Neilsen Ltd. in Toronto, a large food conglomerate, where he worked on the Haagen-Dazs ice cream account. In 1985, Pillsbury bought Haagen-Dazs and recruited him to work for it in New York, where he stayed until 1991 working in sales, marketing, business development and retail shops. For the next year-and-a-half, Simon worked as vice president of sales and marketing for Slim-Fast Foods. He then started his own company. He is married and has one child.
